subject: Re: Mike's Box 12.470 Proto 1
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
OK, I'm making progress, as I have mounted the amplified speakers in 
the project box, and installed an internal speaker running off of "My 
Lil Reminder."  So, I have a good mix of white noise and radio bits 
moving in the chamber, with an amplified mic mounted within.  I 
recorded what sounds like "just work on it." (and I am thinking: I'm 
tryin'!  I'm tryin'!)

Mike, please explain how I get to hear what the mic is picking up 
before it goes into the recorder?  I know I need a splitter of some 
sort, but do I need amped headset/ear buds?  What is the type of 
splitter called?  And for my last question, can I get a copy of the 
white/pink noise audio file from you?  My e-mail addy is:
lcdupla@...

Thanks a bunch for answering my questions.

LC
http://www.AngelsGhosts.com


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
<michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
>
> Hi LC,
> 
> Yes, the 12-469 has that "clicking" sound while sweeping the AM 
band. 
> All my 12-469's do it.  Maybe someone can come up with a way to 
quiet 
> it?
> 
> I use the older version 12-470 in my sound chamber method. The 
older 
> 12-470 has a quieter sweep mode, no "clicking".  Plus it has the 
> built-in speaker which I really like!
> 
> The 12-470 doesn't pick up the "My Lil Reminder" internally as far 
as 
> I can tell. It just mixes the sounds in the sound chamber.  The 12-
> 469 and 12-470 use different circuit boards.  Maybe the 12-470 has 
> better filtering???
> 
> (Note: The newer version of the 12-470 (black, non-hack one) has an 
> entirely different circuit board too).
> 
> The clam pack was the packaging for an item I bought for my old 
cell 
> phone.  I saw it and used it for the proto 1.  I'm now looking for 
a 
> more durable clear box so I can build a few more of these systems 
> using 12-470's.
> 
> - Mike
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> >
> > Mike, two more questions for you.  When I sweep the AM dial, I 
get 
> a 
> > loud "click" on each frequency as it scans.  Also, when the "My 
Lil 
> > Reminder" playing white noise gets near the AM radio sweep, it 
gets 
> > picked up by the unit and broadcasts it.  Are you experiencing 
the 
> > same thing?  Also, where are you getting the clam packs?
> > 
> > LC
> >

> > > 
> > > - Mike

> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > OK, I am working with a 12-469, as the old 470 models are all 
> > gone 
> > > in 
> > > > my area.  I purchased an amplifed speaker(s) to add to the 
> earbud 
> > > > jack and an amplified mic to add to my audio recorder.  As 
> > > mentioned 
> > > > before, my plans are to build an echo chamber for the 12-469, 
> > > piping 
> > > > the audio through the speaker(s) into one end of the box, and 
> > > > capturing on the mic at the far end.  I am also putting sound 
> > holes 
> > > > (like a grill) on the far end, so the sound can come out and 
be 
> > > heard 
> > > > by all.  The proect boxes come in various sizes and are cheap 
> at 
> > > > Radio Shack.  They should prove perfect for an echo chamber. 
> > > > 
> > > > How am I doing, Mike?
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> > > > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Hi LC,
> > > > > Yes... that sounds like it would work just fine.
> > > > > - Mike

wrote:

within

> > > > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> > > > > > > > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Hi LC,
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > The two setups I did were:
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > 1) Three 12-469's through a mixer, mixed with white 
> > noise 
> > > > > > > > (performed 
> > > > > > > > > with Audacity), my voice via a microphone, and all 
> that 
> > > > audio 
> > > > > > > > > captured using a free program called "Scanner 
> > Recorder". 
> > > > You 
> > > > > > can 
> > > > > > > > > download it here: http://www.davee.com/scanrec/
> > > > > > > > > I have not really taken that unit anywhere to test 
it 
> > > > > > properly.  
> > > > > > > I 
> > > > > > > > > only did the original testing you hear on the video.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > 2) One 12-470 placed in a "chamber", with a noise 
> > > generator 
> > > > > > (used 
> > > > > > > > > a "My Lil' Reminder" 20 second digital 
> recorder/player) 
> > > > with 
> > > > > > > > recorded 
> > > > > > > > > white/pink noise I captured while in Florida.  Also 
> > > inside 
> > > > is 
> > > > > > > > > a "Listen Up" amplified microphone and an Olympus 
> > digital 
> > > > > > > recorder.
> > > > > > > > > The only wiring is a Y-connector which connects the 
> > > output 
> > > > from 
> > > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > > amplified mic to the input of the recorder, and 
also 
> to 
> > > ear-
> > > > > > buds 
> > > > > > > > for 
> > > > > > > > > listening to what is being recorded. You can also 
> plug 
> > a 
> > > > small 
> > > > > > > > > speaker into this if desired.
> > > > > > > > > The raw audio from the linear sweep of either the 
AM 
> or 
> > > FM 
> > > > band 
> > > > > > > is 
> > > > > > > > > projected from the 12-470 speaker, into the 
> > > > closed "chamber", 
> > > > > > > along 
> > > > > > > > > with the audio from the speaker of the noise 
> generator 
> > > ("My 
> > > > > > Lil' 
> > > > > > > > > Reminder") unit.  Those two sources, plus any 
ambient 
> > > noise 
> > > > > > > inside 
> > > > > > > > > the "chamber" is picked up by the amplified mic and 
> fed 
> > > > into 
> > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > > recorder and ear-buds. The recorder produces 
the .wav 
> > > file.
> > > > > > > > > You can use a 12-469 instead of the 12-470. You 
just 
> > need 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > > > connect 
> > > > > > > > > a small speker to the output of the 12-469.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > As with my three 12-469 system, I have so far only 
> done 
> > > the 
> > > > > > > initial 
> > > > > > > > > test run on th 12-470 system.  I hope to bring both 
> > units 
> > > > to a 
> > > > > > > > place 
> > > > > > > > > where I can do some better experimentation.  I have 
2 
> > > weeks 
> > > > off 
> > > > > > > > near 
> > > > > > > > > Christmas time, so that is probably when I'll be 
> doing 
> > > that.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > I hope I have answered your questions, LC.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > - Mike
> > > > > > > > >
